Crisis.Name: BP Oil Spill
Crisis.EconomicImpact: 4.9 million barrels of oil lost, bad pollution

Organization.Name: Google
Organization.History: Started initially as a research project for Larry Page and Sergey Brin to create a search engine that would rank search results by relevancy and importance

Organization.Name: FEMA
Organization.History: Created in 1979 to respond to disasters

Organization.Name: Peace Corps
Organization.History: Established by sets of bills passed following World War II whose purpose was to help developing countries. Idea eventually developed into a volunteer organization funded by the American government.

Organization.Name: CDC
Organization.History: Founded as the Communicable Diseases Center on July 1st 1946, created originally to deal with malaria and was originally based in Atlanta. It has evolved into a general disease research center.

Organization.Name: USGS
Organization.History: Created by an act of Congress on March 3rd 1879 to survey and classify the lands acquired in the Louisiana Purchase and the Mexican War

Organization.Name: UNAMIR
Organization.History: Created by the UN to support the Rwandans during conflict

Organization.Name: American Red Cross
Organization.History: Established in Washington, D.C. by Clara Barton in 1881 to bring crises relief to individuals in the U.S.

Organization.Name: United Nations
Organization.History: Designed as a replacement to the League of Nations under the goal of preventing another world war though cooperative problem solving to international problems.

Organization.Name: Salvation Army
Organization.History: Started by William and Catherine Booth as service organization modeled after military hiarchy under the notion that to be effective the organization need to have the force of an army.

Organization.Name: WHO
Organization.History: Established on 7 April 1948, as member of the United Nations Development Group to eradicate smallpox

CrisisKind.Name: Conflict
CrisisKind.Description: A conflict, usually violent, that occurs either on the worldwide or regional scale.

CrisisKind.Name: Fire
CrisisKind.Description: A wildfire that occurs within a specific region.

CrisisKind.Name: Genocide
CrisisKind.Description: A mass killing of a racial or ethnic group

CrisisKind.Name: Hurricane
CrisisKind.Description: A storm from the tropics with high winds and lots of rain

CrisisKind.Name: Tornado
CrisisKind.Description: A natural disaster caused by a tornado.

CrisisKind.Name: Miscellaneous
CrisisKind.Description: Anything that does not fall under another category

OrganizationKind.Name: Governmental Organization
OrganizationKind.Description: An organization chartered by the government for a specific purpose such as research or diplomatic relations and negotiation.

OrganizationKind.Name: Health
OrganizationKind.Description: An agency that tries to preserve public health

OrganizationKind.Name: National Security
OrganizationKind.Description: Tends to matters of national security

OrganizationKind.Name: Miscellaneous
OrganizationKind.Description: Organizations that did not fall into any other category

PersonKind.Name: Personality
PersonKind.Description: A person well known in pop culture

PersonKind.Name: President
PersonKind.Description: A prime minister of a country

PersonKind.Name: President and CEO
PersonKind.Description: A president and CEO of a company

PersonKind.Name: Vice President
PersonKind.Description: A vice president of a country

PersonKind.Name: Others
PersonKind.Description: Another person that is not listed
